text: Hi, is there anyway to include drag and drop areas within custom modules? I'm using custom modules like building blocks in a template to allow someone to add different sections to their page, ideally it would be great if they could then drag other text fields etc into the page layout. Thanks for your help!

An easy workaround would be to just prefix all of your custom modules - I often find that I dont scan for the one I am looking for I always search for some keyword. The prefix will make it easy to distinguish defaults from custom ones.

<@UKU1Z4X63> I think this is what youre looking for

```{% dnd_area "unique_name", class="main" %}
 
{% end_dnd_area %}```
Source: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/tags/dnd-areas>

OK I feel like I’m banging my head against a wall. If I use a `link` type, there doesn’t seem to be a way to by default have the text for the link be part of that, correct? I need a sperate field for that. And if I use a `simplemenu` it doesn’t expose the actual URL of the link, I need to run through some gymnastics to use the `type` of the item. Am I crazy?

Sounds like ultimately you're trying to build a menu? Have a look at this, you may be able to repurpose some of the code to fit your situation <https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/founders/TheWebTech-Basic-Menu-using-Menu-Function|https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/founders/TheWebTech-Basic-Menu-using-Menu-Function>
